RCU linux

1.5

Introduction

Overview

System requirements

The package can be built on Linux systems. In order to test the specific hardware access a DCS board is necessary. The ARM linux runs in an embedded environment, to build applications for it one needs a Cross Compiler.

The S/W Components

  • The msg_buffer_interface specifies a memory mapped interface between the DCS board and the RCU motherboard. The Message Buffer Encoding module does the job of encoding data buffers in the specific format.
  • The rcu-sh is a low level shell-like tool to access the RCU memory space.
  • The sm_tools module hosts tools to access the SelectMap(tm) interface of the Xilinx FPGA.

The drivers

  • rcubus_driver: The driver provides the access to memory/registers inside the DCS board firmware. Althoug it was originally written to feature the msg_buffer_interface and the communication between the DCS board and the RCU motherboard, it does not contain any RCU specific code. The driver can be used to access three memory regions of configurable location and size inside the firmware address space.
